body.name: Brink of War: A Prosecution Force Thriller (The Prosecution Force Thrillers Book 1)
body.description: Air Force One is down. The president is dead.Maggie Trousdale has been vice president for only forty-eight hours before she’s thrust into the executive office. As smoke rises over Turkey from the wreckage of the former president’s plane, America demands answers. Nobody knows what brought the aircraft down, Turkey has restricted all access to the crash site, and the White House is in chaos.But as the nation unravels, President Trousdale discovers a cryptic message left by her recently deceased predecessor. The attack on Air Force One may not have been a matter of foreign aggression. It may have been an inside job, and if it was, Trousdale is the next target.With crosshairs on her back and no one to trust, Trousdale turns to the only man she knows can’t be bought: disgraced Force Recon Marine and criminal fugitive Reed Montgomery. He’s a violent man with a twisted past, but if anybody can uncover the truth, it’s Montgomery. He’ll need to move quickly because global security is now in jeopardy and the nation stands on the brink of war.The president’s vigilante may be the only man who can bring the free world back from the edge.The hero readers call a mix of Mack Bolan, John Wick, and Mitch Rapp headlines this series of political thrillers ready to shake you to the core and keep you reading late into the night.Uncertain times call for decisive action. Reed Montgomery is up for the challenge._________________What readers are saying:★★★★★ "...brilliant..."★★★★★ "...so darn good..."★★★★★ "...my kind of thriller!"★★★★★ "...Reed is the perfect anti-hero..."★★★★★ "...Ryles will be the next Clancy or Coonts..."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An amazing thrill-ride of a book!
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book from start to finish. There wasn’t one dull moment. Excitement suspense and intrigue are the three things I like most in a book and this one had them all. I’ve already downloaded the second book. Happy reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I loved the storyline a great deal as I thought it was right on with current world events. I look forward to more good stories from this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars brink of war
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyable read!! Kept me interested throughout!! Looking forward to reading book2!! First book of this type I’ve read in along time!! Thanks!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brink of War (Prosecution Force #1)
reviews.reviewText: After the fallout from the takedown of big Pharmaceutical regime, Reed is now a wanted fugitive world wide. Muddy Maggie, Governor of Louisiana, is summoned to the White House by President Brandt following the resignation of the Vice President. President Brandt asks her to accept his offer to become his Vice President. Following her Congressional approval, Brandt leaves for a conference involving Russia, Iran, Italy, and other Nations only to have Air Force One crash near the Iranian border, reason unknown. Maggie's concern, recover the black box before any other countries, and her Prosecutor, Reed Montgomery, along with Turk, are tasked to recover the black box. What ensues is an almost out and out war because Russia and Iran along with Turkey get involved, leaving Reed and Turk not only fighting for their lives, but with no clear way to extract from the area. This will keep you turning pages to reveal what happens with them, but also with now President Maggie, the Russians and the Iranians as well as other Nations. Great read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Action-packed political thriller
reviews.reviewText: Brink of War was my introduction to Logan Ryles storytelling and to his Reed Montgomery series. While the author was new to me, I’ve read a significant number of books published by Severn River Publishing and have enjoyed every one, so I figured based on that track record I’d give this series a shot. I’m sure glad I did because this is a series, I fully intend on reading from beginning to end. I love stories where the “hero” is so obviously damaged they shouldn’t be able to function, yet they have a deeply ingrained spirit of never quit.If you enjoy books that are not just action-packed but full of political intrigue and backstabbing as well as characters who are either likeable or highly questionable Mr. Ryles Prosecution Force thrillers might be your cup of tea. In my case after reading Brink of War, I purchased books two and three in preparation for book four’s release in August. I guess that might qualify me as a fan of this series and Logan Ryles’ storytelling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brink of war a great book
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book from the beginning. I am not a plot killer. Recommend for any patriot or retired military. What do you do while waiting for your favorite authors next book? You find another great author. Getting book two.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Looking forward to book 2
reviews.reviewText: The book had three well developed characters, TBE rest was filer and distraction but that isn't unusual. There were missed opportunities to expand the plot but that wasn't the intent of the writers good quick story was still told and it was memorable enough for me too take a week long break and come back without having to backtrack and catch back up. Worthy of 4.5 stars a s I'll round up this time. Been reading a lot of Ward Laden's writing g and this is just slightly beneath his efforts but in the same rating space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars More than a Blink of war
reviews.reviewText: Interesting and enjoyable, even though there were several stretches of imagination. The final chapters in the White House dialog, action and characters were beyond the realm of belief.
This Book kept in suspense all the way through. I read it in three days and look forward to the next book in this series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great story and kept me hooked all the way. I kept wanting to read the next page, even when to tired. Defiantly read the next book.
Kind of a boring story. No depth. Lame characters. From beginning to end I was thinking "mmh, right..." Don't ask why I even bothered to read it through...can't give a good answer to that

The prosecution series featuring Reed Montgomery is far better and thrilling than the original Reed Montgomery series. It keeps you up at night and on edge throughout the book.Loved the 1st book very much and hoping the next and upcoming books do not disappoint.
A good paces action novel, easy to read and didnt dwell too much on the detail or repeat the same information. Every enjoyable with a bit of everthing woven in.
